scripts.title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find
scripts.text: Well, this one tells a story - seems like it might be cautionary. The moral of the tale is supposed to resonate with us gals out there. Here's Cass Daley with A Good Man Is Hard to Find.

scripts.title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find
scripts.text: Cass Daley sings this tune that makes us ponder just how rare it is these days to find a man with true character, don't you think? Here's Cass Daley with A Good Man Is Hard to Find.

scripts.title: A Kiss to Build a Dream On
scripts.text: Louis, you've got me wondering what kind of dream might be built on just one tender kiss. Here's the legendary Satchmo himself with that heartfelt tune - it's Louis Armstrong and his classic rendition of "A Kiss to Build a Dream On".

scripts.title: A Kiss to Build a Dream On
scripts.text: Louis, what is it that drives us humans forward? Is it the promise of tomorrow or perhaps just one special moment between two souls tonight under neon lights on the Strip? Here he comes with his trumpet serenading your heartache and longing. It's Louis Armstrong crooning A Kiss to Build a Dream On!

scripts.title: A Room With a View
scripts.text: Now we're in for something sweet and dreamy, as only the master of clarinet himself can deliver. I wonder if this tune captures that same wistful longing you feel when gazing out at an idyllic view - it's almost like Artie Shaw is serenading us through his window pane right now! Here's Artie Shaw with A Room With a View.

scripts.title: A Room With a View
scripts.text: A room, the very walls that separate you and me… it would be nothing without this enchanting melody filling our space. Let Artie Shaw serenade us with his "Room With a View." It's now time to swing into some magic as we play "A Room With a View" by none other than clarinet legend, the incomparable Artie Shaw!

scripts.title: Address Unknown
scripts.text: The longing in these lyrics is palpable - like a letter lost, and the writer desperate to reconnect. Here are The Ink Spots lamenting an "Address Unknown". A song about searching for that special someone when they're out of reach… just as we Appalachians have our own struggles finding connection after everything changed around us here in this post-war wasteland. Anyway - let's hear it: It's the smooth harmonies of The Ink Spots with Address Unknown, coming up next on your local radio station!

scripts.title: Address Unknown
scripts.text: The tender melancholy in these harmonies tugs at the heartstrings, don't they? It's a poignant lament for lost love and unrequited yearning. Here to soothe your soul is… The Ink Spots with their heartfelt 'Address Unknown'.

scripts.title: Ain't Misbehavin'
scripts.text: I've got a hunch that when the title says "Ain't misbehavin'", it means exactly what you'd think - acting up, causing trouble. But with this lively tune by Fats Waller… I'm wondering if sometimes just letting loose and having fun is its own kind of mischief in disguise! Here's Fats Waller with Ain't Misbehavin'.

scripts.title: Ain't Misbehavin'
scripts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, get ready to tap your toes as we swing into a lively tune all about having fun without worrying what others think. Here comes the incomparable Fats Waller with his classic "Ain't Misbehavin'".

scripts.title: All of Me
scripts.text: You know, it seems like Billie is pouring her heart out in this one. She's saying she needs all or nothing - leave as you found me… imperfect but still worth keeping close. Here's Billie Holiday with "All of Me".

scripts.title: All of Me
scripts.text: New Vegas, this song right here is the definition of vulnerability and surrender. It speaks to that raw emotional place where you're willing to give up everything for love. Here's Billie Holiday with her iconic rendition of "All Of Me".

scripts.title: All Or Nothing At All
scripts.text: This song seems to be saying that it's all or nothing in love - either you've got a deep, complete feeling for someone, or not at all. That intensity is something I think we can probably all relate to when matters of the heart come into play. Here now is Billie Holiday with All Or Nothing At All.

scripts.title: All Or Nothing At All
scripts.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the Mojave Wasteland, are we prepared to give our hearts entirely or not at all? That seems to be the burning question posed in this next song. Here is Ms. Lady Day herself, crooning about nothing less than a full commitment - no half measures will do when it comes to love. Billie Holiday with All Or Nothing At All!

scripts.title: American Patrol
scripts.text: Glenn Miller seems to tap into that sense of national pride and unity we all crave, don't you think? Here he is now with his classic piece - it's the one and only: Glenn Miller performing American Patrol.

scripts.title: American Patrol
scripts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, this next tune has always gotten me moving on the dance floor of Benny's Bistro out here in New Vegas. The crisp brass section is as lively and carefree as a night stroll down the Strip after a big NCR victory! Here it goes - Glenn Miller with American Patrol!

scripts.title: Another Saturday Night (take)
scripts.text: You know, sometimes I wonder if there are more folks out dancing the night away than safely tucked in their homes when these late nights fall on Saturdays. At least according to this upbeat tune from our good friend Sam Cooke - here he is with Another Saturday Night (take), bringing that lively energy right into your living room!

scripts.title: Another Saturday Night (take)
scripts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the neon lights of New Vegas' Strip are shimmering tonight as we bring you this soulful tune about a night out on town. Who among us hasn't been to that favorite bar or club when the weekend rolls around? Here's Sam Cooke with Another Saturday Night (take).

scripts.title: Anything Goes
scripts.text: So many things have changed over the centuries - laws, morals… you name it. But as this song says: "Anything goes." I wonder if that philosophy holds up in today's world out there beyond these Appalachia hills? Here's Cole Porter with Anything Goes.
